page.title: 20Interview with Vicar cont.
page.content: There is a{Sunday school}with about 40 children, held at the same time as the general service. There are roughly 6{weddings}and 6{christenings}a year. The Rev. Richards also conducts{burial {services,}though the graveyard is too full for use now.Richard Coeur de Lion has a relative buried there while a plaque in the church records the birth of{Francis Bacon}in the village. { Harvest}and{Christmas}services draw many more people than usual. At{Easter there is a{parade}around the village led by a donkey and followed by a crowd waving palm leaves. The Rev. Richards enjoys his work. He likes being involved with people but the one thing he does not like is having to try to force through changes in the church against the reluctance of his parishioners. He wishes he didn't have to do that.
